description: Oman captain Jatinder Singh expressed confidence ahead of their final T20 World Cup clash against a struggling Australia. Despite both teams being eliminated, Singh believes T20 cricket is about momentum and seizing key moments, aiming to capitalize on Australia's current form. The Omani squad remains positive and determined to make their mark in their last match.

description: India is set to implement new trade agreements with the United States, the United Kingdom, and Oman in the coming months. An interim deal with the US is expected to be formalized in March and come into effect in April. This pact will see reciprocal tariffs reduced.

Salman Khan visits father Salim Khan in hospital, urges docs to maintain privacy
description: Salman Khan visited Mumbai’s Lilavati Hospital to see his ailing father Salim Khan on ventilator support after a minor brain haemorrhage. He paused 'Battle of Galwan' shoot. Salman urged doctors to keep health private, upset over public updates. Family seeks privacy amid speculation.

title: The Drishyam trap: How Jeethu Joseph tricked us into rooting against Georgekutty before the ultimate April 2026 finale
OpenAI teases Anthropic with OpenClaw hire in viral pic of Altman & Dario Amodei
description: OpenAI's ChatGPT account playfully mocked rival Anthropic by sharing an edited photo of Sam Altman with lobster claws, referencing a recent talent acquisition. This move follows a period of intense competition, including Anthropic's funding and a Super Bowl ad targeting OpenAI, and a dispute over the OpenClaw project.

'You're my best gift this year': Mahieka reacts to Hardik's birthday post
description: Cricketer Hardik Pandya celebrated his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma's 25th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post featuring a video of them enjoying fireworks and releasing a lantern. Pandya expressed his love and gratitude, to which Sharma responded by calling him her best gift. The couple has been publicly seen together since Pandya confirmed their relationship in October 2025.

title: ‘Mission failure’: Nasa’s harsh verdict on Sunita Williams’ Starliner mission
description: NASA has classified Boeing's Starliner mission as a "Type A mishap" following a troubled 2024 flight that left astronauts stranded for months. The agency cited technical flaws and management shortcomings, emphasizing leadership accountability and the need for corrective actions before future flights. NASA acknowledged its own role in accepting the vehicle and launching the crew.

title: Unexplained skin changes? Here are 5 signs that maybe liver-related
description: Your skin can reveal hidden liver issues long before blood tests. Experts highlight signs like persistent itching, unexplained yellowing of skin and eyes (jaundice), spider-like red veins, darkening in skin folds, and easy bruising. These changes, often dismissed, signal the liver's struggle. Early detection through lifestyle changes and tests is crucial.

description: A 3.5-year-old girl was raped and strangled to death in Gurgaon after being lured away by a neighbour. The 25-year-old accused, a native of Bihar, confessed to the crime during police interrogation. He admitted to taking the child to an empty place and then killing her to destroy evidence.

Ishan Kishan's explosive 77 powered India to 175/7, a target Pakistan couldn't chase, falling for 114. This win secured India's Super Eight spot unbeaten.

He is discussing how ancient Indian philosophies connect with modern AI. Ranvir is also sharing his contributions to India's GDP and AI literacy through an Indian AI model. He has previously met global tech leaders and the UN Secretary-General.

description: Uttar Pradesh government has upheld Supreme Court directives on loudspeaker usage, denying requests for mosque announcements during Ramzan.  While Samajwadi Party members argued for 'sehri' and 'iftar' calls, the state cited the 10 pm to 6 am sound restriction.  Officials stated mobile phones make traditional time announcements unnecessary, emphasizing adherence to judicial orders over religious practices.

Total Lunar Eclipse: When is Chandra Grahan? Check date, time & significance
description: Sky watchers in India can witness the first Chandra Grahan of 2026 on March 3rd. This total lunar eclipse will be visible from India. The Moon will turn red, creating a Blood Moon. The visible phase begins around 6:26 PM. People can observe this celestial event with the naked eye. Binoculars or telescopes can enhance the view.

AI health ATMs, file managers and mental health companions: How startups are transforming healthcare access and diagnostics
Unable to bear labour pain, UP woman slits her abdomen with knife; delivers healthy baby
description: A Bahraich woman, Nankai Kumari, in extreme labour pain and alone, allegedly cut her abdomen with a knife to deliver her baby. Villagers found her critically injured, but doctors at a local health centre successfully facilitated a normal delivery of a healthy baby girl. The mother was later transferred to Lucknow for advanced treatment due to severe injuries.

title: Anubhav Sinha says would do his best to not announce Assi box office ‘no matter how good or bad’: ‘It’s just good gossip’
Shillong MP Ricky Andrew J Syngkon dies at 54
Brahmin politics heats up in UP: Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak backs Swami Saraswati’s demand for action against guilty officers
Canada-based gangster boasts he had sarpanch killed at Punjab wedding
description: Police are investigating the murder of AAP sarpanch Harbinder Singh, shot dead at a wedding in Tarn Taran. Fugitive gangster Lakhbir Landa claimed responsibility on social media, citing revenge for alleged harm to his associate. Authorities have detained several suspects and are exploring multiple leads, while political figures decry the state of law and order.

title: 57-year-old Sikh man kidnapped from California gurdwara
description: A Sikh man was allegedly kidnapped from a gurdwara in Tracy, California. Avtar Singh, a cook at the gurdwara Guru Nanak Parkash, was seen entering a white SUV with three unidentified individuals. The San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office is investigating the incident. Surveillance footage shows the victim entering the vehicle against his will.

title: Himachal Pradesh raises entry tax; pvt cars to pay Rs 170 now
description: Himachal Pradesh is increasing vehicle entry fees significantly from April 1st to boost state finances. Private cars will now pay Rs 170, up from Rs 70, while commercial buses face a Rs 600 charge. The government will also implement FASTag and online barrier auctions to improve efficiency at key entry points.

title: India should ban social media for U-15: Macron
'Mother died due to her': How techie plotted pregnant ex-wife's murder in Hyderabad
description: A pregnant woman was brutally murdered by her ex-husband in Hyderabad, a crime meticulously planned weeks in advance. The accused tracked her movements, procured weapons including a chainsaw, and intended to break into her home. He harbored a grudge over their divorce and her remarriage, having previously faced a domestic violence case.

title: Rajasthan MLA compares BJP budget to ‘son’, Congress's budget to ‘daughter’, row erupts
description: Women's rights groups have demanded action against BJP MLA Bahadur Singh Koli for his remarks in the Rajasthan Assembly. Koli compared the current BJP government's budgets to "having a son" and previous Congress budgets to "having a daughter," deeming the former productive and the latter responsible for the Congress's defeat. The organizations condemned the analogy as patriarchal and regressive.

title: UP authorities bulldoze barber shop after ‘sexual assault’ on 8-year-old girl sparks protests
description: Authorities in Lakhimpur Kheri demolished a barber shop. This action followed protests demanding strict action against the 22-year-old owner. He is accused of raping an eight-year-old girl. Officials stated the shop was built on encroached land. The demolition occurred amid widespread public outcry over the sexual assault case. The accused has been arrested and the girl is stable.

title: 65-year-old umpire dies in bee attack during cricket match in Uttar Pradesh
description: A senior umpire, Manik Gupta, has died after a bee swarm attacked a cricket match in Shuklaganj Unnao. Gupta, 65, was stung multiple times during a KDMA league game. He was taken to several hospitals before being declared dead. Gupta had served on the KCA umpiring panel for 30 years.
